channel.title: Black Mesa on SSD drive
channel.description: From what I know, source mods must be installed in respective Steam subfolder so that Steam can notice and run them. But Black Mesa, consisting of a lot of small files, would probably load and run much faster on a SSD drive. So is it possible to install it to another location and still launch and play it?

item.title: Black Mesa on SSD drive
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
Steam > Settings > Downloads > Steam Library Folders > Add Library Folder

You can have multiple libraries on multiple drives, they don’t all need to be in one.
